bowt.bot

Class Bot

  • java.lang.Object
    • bowt.bot.Bot

  • public class Bot
extends java.lang.Object
    A class which provides basic methods for a Discord bot.

    Basic implementation

    A basic implementation would look something like this: 

     Bot bot = new Bot("your_bot_token", "your_command_prefix");
 bot.login();
    Author:
    ⋈

    • Method Detail

      • buildClient

        public void buildClient(java.lang.String token)
        Builds a IDiscordClient with the given token and assigns it to client.

        This called automatically if you use Bot(String) or Bot(String, String).

        Parameters:
        token - The application token.

      • login

        public void login()
           throws BowtieClientException
        Logs the client into Discord.

        You have to call buildClient(String) first.

        Throws:
        BowtieClientException - If the client is null.

      • logout

        public void logout()
            throws BowtieClientException
        Logs the client out of Discord.
        Throws:
        BowtieClientException - If the client is null.

        Returns:

                    throws BowtieClientException

      • createGuildObjects

        public java.util.List<GuildObject> createGuildObjects()
        Creates a GuildObject for each connected guild and adds them to the guilds list.
        Returns:
        The list of GuildObjects or null if the client has not been built yet.

      • getGuildObjects

        Adds a single GuildObject to the guilds list.
        Parameters:
        guild - The GuildObect which should be added.
        Returns:
        true if the GuildObject was not yet contained in the guilds list and was added successfully.

      • removeGuildObject

        public boolean removeGuildObject(GuildObject guild)
        Remooves the given GuildObject from the guilds list.
        Parameters:
        guild - The GuildObect which should be removed.
        Returns:
        true if guilds contained the given GuildObject and if it was successfully removed.

      • removeGuildObject

        Returns:

      • getGuildObjectByID

        public GuildObject getGuildObjectByID(java.lang.String guildID)
        Searches the guilds list for a GuildObject with the given ID and returns it.
        Parameters:
        guildID - The String ID of the GuildObject that should be returned.
        Returns:
        The GuildObject with the given ID or null if no element in guilds has the given ID.

      • addCreator

        public boolean addCreator(sx.blah.discord.handle.obj.IUser user)
        Adds the given user to the creators list which enables him to use every command.
        Parameters:
        user - The user which should be added as a creator.
        Returns:
        true if the user was not yet a creator and was successfully added to creators.

      • loadCreators

        public int loadCreators()
        Loads the ID's from the 'creators' field in the property file.

        ID's loaded by this are treated as creators and are able to use any command on any guild.

        Returns:
        The number of creators or -1 if the client has not been built yet.

      • removeCreator

        public boolean removeCreator(sx.blah.discord.handle.obj.IUser user)
        Removes the given user from creators if he was contained.
        Parameters:
        user - The user which should no longer be a creator.
        Returns:
        true if the user was successfully removed from creators.

      • removeCreator

        public sx.blah.discord.handle.obj.IUser removeCreator(int index)
        Removes the IUser at the given position from creators.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the user which should no longer be a creator inside creators.
        Returns:
        The user which was removed.

      • getToken

        public java.lang.String getToken()
        Gets the application token the bot is using to log into Discord with.
        Returns:
        The application token.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String message,
                        sx.blah.discord.handle.obj.IChannel channel,
                        java.awt.Color color,
                        java.lang.String icon,
                        boolean fast)
        Sends an embedded message to the given channel.
        Parameters:
        message - The text of the message.
        channel - The channel to which the message should be sent. Can be a private channel.
        color - The color of the embeded message.
        icon - The icon that will be displayed in the foootnote.
        fast - true if the message should be sent directly, false if it should be added to the RequestBuffer. Sending it directly can mean that message wont be sent at all if the rate limit is exceeded.
        See Also:
        sendMessage(String, IChannel), sendMessage(String, IChannel, boolean), sendMessage(String, IChannel, Color), sendMessage(String, IChannel, String), sendMessage(String, IChannel, Color, boolean), sendMessage(String, IChannel, Color, String), sendMessage(String, IChannel, String, boolean)

                        java.awt.Color color,
                        boolean fast)
        Sends an embedded message to the given channel.
        Parameters:
        message - The text of the message.
        channel - The channel to which the message should be sent. Can be a private channel.
        color - The color of the embeded message.
        fast - true if the message should be sent directly, false if it should be added to the RequestBuffer. Sending it directly can mean that message wont be sent at all if the rate limit is exceeded.
        See Also:
        sendMessage(String, IChannel, Color, String, boolean)

      • sendListMessage

        public void sendListMessage(java.lang.String title,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> messages,
                            sx.blah.discord.handle.obj.IChannel channel,
                            java.awt.Color color,
                            java.lang.String icon,
                            int numberPerMsg,
                            boolean inline)
        Sends an embedded message with the elements from the list to the given channel. If the list contains more elements than 'numberPerMsg' this method will create another embedded message.
        Parameters:
        title - The text displayed on top of the first message.
        messages - All the messages that should be listed.
        channel - The channel to which the messages should be sent. Can be a private channel.
        color - The color of the embeded messages.
        icon - The icon that will be displayed in the foootnotes.
        numberPerMsg - The number of elements per message. Or -1 if the maximum number based on the amount of characters should be used.
        inline - Indicates whether multiple elements should be put in one line.
        See Also:
        sendListMessage(String, List, IChannel, int, boolean), sendListMessage(String, List, IChannel, Color, int, boolean), sendListMessage(String, List, IChannel, String, int, boolean)

      • sendListMessage

        public void sendListMessage(java.lang.String title,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> messages,
                            sx.blah.discord.handle.obj.IChannel channel,
                            java.lang.String icon,
                            int numberPerMsg,
                            boolean inline)
        Sends an embedded message with the elements from the list to the given channel. If the list contains more elements than 'numberPerMsg' this method will create another embedded message.
        Parameters:
        title - The text displayed on top of the first message.
        messages - All the messages that should be listed.
        channel - The channel to which the messages should be sent. Can be a private channel.
        icon - The icon that will be displayed in the foootnotes.
        numberPerMsg - The number of elements per message. Or -1 if the maximum number based on the amount of characters should be used.
        inline - Indicates whether multiple elements should be put in one line.
        See Also:
        sendListMessage(String, List, IChannel, Color, String, int, boolean)

      • sendListMessage

        public void sendListMessage(java.lang.String title,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> messages,
                            sx.blah.discord.handle.obj.IChannel channel,
                            java.awt.Color color,
                            int numberPerMsg,
                            boolean inline)
        Sends an embedded message with the elements from the list to the given channel. If the list contains more elements than 'numberPerMsg' this method will create another embedded message.
        Parameters:
        title - The text displayed on top of the first message.
        messages - All the messages that should be listed.
        channel - The channel to which the messages should be sent. Can be a private channel.
        color - The color of the embeded messages.
        numberPerMsg - The number of elements per message. Or -1 if the maximum number based on the amount of characters should be used.
        inline - Indicates whether multiple elements should be put in one line.
        See Also:
        sendListMessage(String, List, IChannel, Color, String, int, boolean)

      • sendListMessage

        public void sendListMessage(java.lang.String title,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> messages,
                            sx.blah.discord.handle.obj.IChannel channel,
                            int numberPerMsg,
                            boolean inline)
        Sends an embedded message with the elements from the list. If the list contains more elements than 'numberPerMsg' this method will create another embedded message.
        Parameters:
        title - The text displayed on top of the first message.
        messages - All the messages that should be listed.
        channel - The channel to which the messages should be sent. Can be a private channel.
        numberPerMsg - The number of elements per message. Or -1 if the maximum number based on the amount of characters should be used.
        inline - Indicates whether multiple elements should be put in one line.
        See Also:
        sendListMessage(String, List, IChannel, Color, String, int, boolean)

      • sendPlainMessage

        public void sendPlainMessage(java.lang.String message,
                             sx.blah.discord.handle.obj.IChannel channel,
                             boolean fast)
        Sends a standard text message to the given channel.
        Parameters:
        message - The text of the message.
        channel - The channel to which the message should be sent. Can be a private channel.
        fast - true if the message should be sent directly, false if it should be added to the RequestBuffer. Sending it directly can mean that message wont be sent at all if the rate limit is exceeded.
        See Also:
        sendPlainMessage(String, IChannel)

      • sendPlainMessage

        public void sendPlainMessage(java.lang.String message,
                             sx.blah.discord.handle.obj.IChannel channel)
        Sends a standard text message to the given channel.
        Parameters:
        message - The text of the message.
        channel - The channel to which the message should be sent. Can be a private channel.
        See Also:
        sendPlainMessage(String, IChannel, boolean)
